text: JESSICA QUIST, Deponent, having been satisfactorily identified and duly sworn by the Notary Public, deposes and states as follows:
Good morning.  Good afternoon.  Thank you for being here.  Could you please state your name for the record?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Jessica Quist.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is your current job?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I'm a registered nurse.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Saint Vincent's Hospital.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was your job on December 1st, 2013?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: A registered nurse.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: St. Francis Home.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you had a deposition before?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So I'd just like to go over a few ground rules.  First, the result of today will be a written transcript of everything we say, so it's important that we don't talk over each other, which means that even if you know what my question is probably going to say or if I think I know what you're about to answer, if we could just let each other both finish, it makes the transcript cleaner.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If you don't understand a question, please just let me know, and I'd be happy to re-ask.  If you do answer, I'll assume you understood.  Is that fair?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: That's fair.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If you need a break at any point, that's totally fine.  Please just let us know.  We'll be happy to accommodate you.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Counsel, is the usual stipulations agreeable?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Agreed.
speaker: MR. MCLAUGHLIN

text: Agreed.
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Yes.
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: Did you drive on Route 290 on December 1st, 2013?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where were you coming from that day?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Home.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where was home?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Proctor Street, Worcester.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where were you going?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: To work at St. Francis.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What time did you get up that day?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't remember what time I got up. Probably, I would assume, 5:30 to get ready for work.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What time did you have to be at work?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: What time did you leave your house?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I mean, that's a long time ago.  I don't really remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: At some point while driving on Route 290, did you see vehicles stopped in front of you?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where approximately on Route 290 did you see those vehicles?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I was coming -- it's kind of, like, a hill, I guess.  I was coming up over the highway.  It was right in front -- prior to the exit, you could see a sign for Bocado restaurant.  I'm not a hundred percent sure what exit number that is.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm sorry.  What restaurant?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Bocado.  You can see the sign for it on the building.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that sign still there today?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't know.  Yes.  I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The hill you mentioned, where was that hill in relation to the vehicles that you saw stopped?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: The vehicles that I saw stopped were up ahead prior to the exit, so, I mean, I don't know how many feet or anything like that.  I just saw it up ahead.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So "up ahead," beyond the hill from where you were?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.  On that particular highway you drive, and there's just a little hill up and a little down.  It's not any big hill.  I guess it's just an incline and a decline maybe.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When did you first see those cars stopped in relation to the hill?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Could you see them before the hill?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Possibly.  I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What did you do when you saw the vehicles stopped in the road?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: The vehicles were from both sides of the highway.  So some on the left and the right.  There was no way that I was going to be able to drive past any of them unless I drove through them.  So I pulled to the right.  I was driving in the right lane, so I tried to get over to the right as much as possible, and I put my car in park.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall how many lanes there were?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: That's a three-lane highway.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is there a shoulder lane?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: A breakdown lane, you mean?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Sure.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And prior to the accident -- immediately prior to the accident, what lane were you driving in?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: On the right.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The rightmost lane?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then you said you pulled over?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I tried to pull over closer to the jersey barrier of the highway.  There was nowhere else for me to go.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What do you mean by "jersey barrier"?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: There's a cement barrier, I guess, on the side of the highway, and then over that -- it's a bridge right there.  So if you go over that cement, you go over the bridge.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'd like to show you what's been marked as Exhibit 2.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Sure.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you tell me whether the vehicle you were driving that day appears in that photograph?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes, it does.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does your vehicle in that photograph have a number over it?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Which number?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Five.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The object in the left of the photo, is that what you would describe as the jersey wall?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yeah, the cement wall or whatever that is.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Which appears to the far left of car number 2 in this photograph?  Is that the jersey wall you're describing?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Correct.  So when I was driving, it would be my right.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you said you pulled -- tried to pull close to that jersey wall?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I tried to, correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How close were you able to get to it?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: As close as you see here because that car was able to wedge itself in between myself and the wall.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So when did you notice the car number 2, the VW Bug, when did you first notice that vehicle?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I was parked.  That car came up on the right side of me and wedged itself in.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember about how long after you parked that the VW Bug wedged itself in?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't.  Everything happened very fast.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you able to -- or what caused your car to stop?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I slowed down.  I put the brakes on and put it in park.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you were able to stop the vehicle just using the brakes?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you put your vehicle in park, do you recall whether there was a vehicle to your right?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.  It was just me.  Are you talking about the Volkswagen?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yeah.  Was that car there yet?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.  It was just me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So when you put your car in park, there was empty space to the right of your car?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If I can show you what's been marked as Exhibit 4.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does this photograph depict the hill you were describing in 290?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yeah.  That's kind of the hill that -- I mean, it's not a huge hill, but I guess it's a little bit of an incline.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does this photograph show the incline portion from where you were driving?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.  I mean -- yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'd like to show you what's been marked as Exhibit 5, and does this depict the decline portion of the hill you were describing on Route 290?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Hold on.  Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you know how many lanes are on 290 on this photograph?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Four.  It looks like one, two, three, four.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So counting from the left, one, two, three, and four, which lane were you driving in immediately prior to the accident?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: It would have been this third lane.  Three from the left.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And is that the same lane that you stopped your vehicle in and put it in park?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't remember only because all of the cars up ahead of me, and there were cars sliding everywhere, so all I did was just try to move to the right and put my car in park.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If I could show you again Exhibit 2.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Is that page 1?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: Page 1 of Exhibit 2 with the numbers on the cars.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Did you observe the car that has the number 3 on it prior to stopping your vehicle?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.  There was no cars directly in front of me prior to stopping my vehicle.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: At some point, did you observe the vehicle, the number 3, on this photo?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't remember that particular car.  I did not -- I don't remember that particular car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall the vehicle that's marked with the number 1 in this page 1 of Exhibit 2?  When you first observed that?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: That looks like the hood of that vehicle. Is that the hood of that vehicle?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall whether there was any vehicle in front of number 3?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall seeing the vehicle marked number 4 in this photograph after the accident?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall seeing this truck marked as number 6 at any point?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When did you first observe the truck marked number 6?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I was parked.  At that time, I had called work because I had a feeling I probably wasn't going to be going in that morning, and as I was on the phone with work, that truck was sliding that way towards the back of my car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What do you mean "that way"?  At an angle to the road?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yeah.  So my car was here, and it was sliding this way.  I don't know how to describe what that's -- so the truck was sideways and sliding towards me, and I saw that in the rearview mirror.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How far away was the truck when you saw it sliding?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't know.  I don't know distance.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did the sliding truck hit your vehicle?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: It did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When the truck hit your vehicle, do you recall whether there were any vehicles in front of your car at that point?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was anyone else in the car with you that day?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you injured in the accident?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I just had minor whiplash.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you seek medical treatment?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I went to an urgent care.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When did you get out of the vehicle after the accident?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I got out of the vehicle when I heard the crashing quiet.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What crashing did you hear after your vehicle came to a stop?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Just the crashing, I would assume, is all the cars hitting each other.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you hear separate crashes?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: There was a lot of commotion on the highway.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did your vehicle come into contact with the vehicle marked number 3 on Exhibit 2?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Do you mean -- what do you mean "come into contact"?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did the cars ever touch?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Possibly.  I didn't drive into the car, if that's what you're asking.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: No, I'm not asking.  Do you remember whether the cars ever came into physical contact, number 3 and your vehicle?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't remember the actual event that happened that they would have come into contact, I guess.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'd like to show you Exhibit 1.  Page 1 of Exhibit 1.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Sure.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you observe any of the vehicles in this photograph after the accident?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.  Meaning --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I know we already spoke -- is the truck here with the number 3 on it the same truck that we were talking about previously that you said was sliding?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Possibly.  I didn't -- when I got out of my car that morning, I didn't, you know, I guess, survey exactly all the cars.  That could possibly be it.  If that's the same truck as this, then yes. Number 3 as number 6 on Exhibit 2.  If that's the same truck, then yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Then yes, you saw it behind it?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I saw that truck.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And at some point, did you go behind that truck or further back Route 290 from where you were stopped?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: After the accident when they were clearing the highway and when they got us onto city buses to take us off the highway.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'd like to show you what's been marked as Exhibit 3.  Do you recognize the person in this photograph?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you interact with that person at the scene of the accident?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What kind of car were you driving that day?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: A Toyota RAV4.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have any restrictions on your license at that time?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I wear contact lenses.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you wearing them that day?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I was.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: While you were driving?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'd like to show you what we'll mark as Exhibit 6.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: (Exhibit No. 6, Photocopy of Photograph, marked for identification)
Is the vehicle on this photograph the vehicle you were driving that day?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What happened to the hood of your vehicle that day?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: That day, I was hit by multiple cars, so I was driven into.  My car was hit.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, where was your car hit?  What parts of your car, I mean?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: So the front of my car was hit.  The back of my car was hit.  The right side of my car was hit. A couple of cars had bounced off of the driver's side of my car and slid elsewhere on the highway.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you say your car was hit from the front, how did that happen?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't remember.  I mean, looking at the picture, it looks like I was driven into on the side -- the driver's side front.  That's what it looks like, but I do not remember that happening.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You said earlier that you were trying to stop your vehicle and pull to the right when you saw vehicles stopped ahead?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Uh-huh.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Just say "yes."
speaker: MR. MCLAUGHLIN

text: Sorry.  Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Thank you.  This isn't normal conversation, but thank you.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I apologize.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's okay.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Did anything prevent you from moving your vehicle further to the right when you were trying to stop it?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No, not that I remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Why did you not move your vehicle further to the right before stopping?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't quite remember, but I think at that time seeing all the cars in front that had hit each other and all the other cars around sliding that I just wanted to stop my car because I didn't know where else to go or what else to do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you stopped your car in the same lane that you had been driving in previously to the accident?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: It must have been.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is it fair to say you stopped your car in a lane of traffic?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: The lane that I was driving in, I guess.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You were driving in a lane of traffic prior to stopping the car?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Well, yes.  I was driving on the highway.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Going back to Exhibit 2, the cars with numbers on them, did you observe at any point the driver of the vehicle with number 3 on it?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you talk with anyone after the accident?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: After the accident, like I said, when all of the noise of the crashes had stopped, when everybody started getting out of their cars, I did ask everybody that was immediately around if everybody was okay, and not one person told me that they were injured.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you injured?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I had said that I had some minor whiplash, but at that time I didn't feel injured, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you tell people at the scene that you were injured?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.  I didn't think anything of it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever see the back of the truck with the number 6 on it?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Do you mean the rear of the truck, like, where it would open?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Right.  Yes.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you observe ice on the roads after getting out of your vehicle?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where did you see ice?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: It was all over the highway.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you observe any ice prior to stopping your vehicle?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I noticed that the roads were wet.  I didn't see the actual ice.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What speed were you driving immediately prior to the -- when you first saw the cars stopped ahead of you, what was your vehicle's speed?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I can't remember.  I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have your windshield wipers on?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have your headlights on?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I must have.  It was dusk.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall what caused the VW Bug marked number 2 to come to a stop?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: It seemed to have wedged itself in between my car and the -- that cement side of the highway.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did it come into contact with your car?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I'm pretty sure that it did, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you talk to any police officers at the scene of the accident?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't remember.  There was police and firefighters, and they were asking if everybody was okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did they ask you if you were okay?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yeah.  They were kind of making their rounds.  So yes, they did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did they ask you any other questions?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Not that I remember, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall when the last time you had applied the brakes prior to stopping your vehicle?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Earlier when we were looking at Exhibit 6, you mentioned that a vehicle might have hit the front of your car?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall that specifically, or you're just saying it was possible?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Possible.  I mean, like I said, multiple cars hit me that morning.  So I don't know exactly what cars did and didn't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So I want to direct your attention on Exhibit 6 to the vehicle on the left, which has a Chrysler logo and the number 20 on it.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall whether that vehicle hit your vehicle?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't remember that vehicle driving into my vehicle.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall anything at all about that vehicle?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's all the questions I have.  Thank you.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Other attorneys get a chance.
speaker: MR. MCLAUGHLIN

text: Do you need a break?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: No.  It's going to escalate from here, so --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: As I said before, my name is Darlene Thebaud, and I represent the defendant Harvey Radey and Stonewall Kitchen in this matter. I'm just going to ask you some follow-up questions.
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: Sure.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You had stated in your Answers to Interrogatories, looking at number 4, "A box truck struck my vehicle from behind."  Do you recall that?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that box truck shown in any of these photographs?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: Yeah.  That's the white truck shown on Exhibit 2, page 2.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And I believe you testified earlier that when you first observed that truck, it was sliding sideways; is that correct?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Before that, did you see that truck driving?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: Do you mean driving straight like a regular car would?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: No, I didn't.  I was on the phone with work, and I happened to look in my rearview mirror, and I saw it sliding towards me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: This was after your vehicle came to a stop, correct?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you saw it out of your driver's side rear-view --
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: My rear-view mirror.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Did you see the driver of that truck as it was sliding?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: I did not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Did you ever speak to the driver of that truck?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And after at the accident scene, do you recall speaking to the driver of that truck?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Do you ever recall speaking to anyone that had a mustache at the scene?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: No.  I don't remember that long ago.  Like I said, that morning was very overwhelming, I guess, could be a word.  So I just remember everyone was kind of standing around.  It was a big open space where kind of everyone had gathered getting out of their car, and everybody was asking is everyone okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the Exhibit 6, that's the one --
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: With my car?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Right.  That car that's in front of you there with the license plate 20, did you speak to the driver of that car?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: I don't know if I spoke to the person.  I mean, I had asked around, so I don't know who drove what car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You testified you didn't see that car driving before the accident occurred, correct?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you said you experienced some whiplash as a result of the accident?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you make a claim for injury?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: (Witness nodding head)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you believe that there's anything that you could have done to avoid the accident?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Thank you.  That's all I have.
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: Good afternoon.  My name is Bridget Lopez. I represent another defendant in this case, Melissa Pomeroy.  Do you know Melissa Pomeroy?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recognize that name at all from the accident scene?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you get any names from people you spoke with at the accident scene?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was the restaurant sign that you said you saw?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Oh, you can see the sign "Bocado."  It's on a brick building on the right that you can see from the highway.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is it --
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: B-O-C-A-D-O.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And were you saying that was the area in the roadway where the accident occurred or where you first started to see vehicles up ahead of you?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: That's -- I just know that I can see it from the highway.  So could you ask me the question again?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Sure.  I just couldn't remember as part of your testimony whether you were using the Bocado restaurant sign as a point of reference when you had pulled your car over or a point of reference when you first started to brake?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: It was just about that area of the highway where the accident had occurred.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know in relation to that Bocado restaurant sign when you first started to brake?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I don't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you wouldn't know if it was before or after that?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did the accident occur on the decline or the incline of that little hill that you described?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: You can answer.
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I would say the decline.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What exit did you get on at 290?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: It's so funny because I never know any exit numbers, but I -- where I lived at that time was Proctor Street, so it was the exit over there.  I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is it Proctor Street that goes right onto 290?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: No, it doesn't.  It's that part of Worcester.  So I'm sorry.  I don't know the exit number.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know what exit you were getting off at to go to Saint Vincent's?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I was going to St. Francis.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know what exit that was?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I don't know the number, but it was the exit that was right there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It was the next exit you would have taken?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Exactly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Were -- you had mentioned you had seen some cars sliding on the road?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was that before you were able to pull over your car, after, or both?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Both.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Do you have any idea why those cars were sliding?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Why they were sliding?  I would say ice.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You did see ice on the road when you exited your vehicle, correct?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Well, I didn't see it, but I slipped.  You know, you're slipping all over the place.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you were walking around the accident scene, you had some difficulty walking on the roadway?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: There was ice, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you fall at all?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall what the weather was at the time you pulled over?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: It was like a freezing rain almost.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And had it been a freezing rain the entire time from the point you left your house to the time of the accident?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: It was raining that morning, and I remember when I had gotten on the highway, it was in the 30s.  So I said to myself I better be careful driving because, you know, it could freeze.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have any difficulty driving on the roadway up until the point that you started to see these cars sliding?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you saw vehicles ahead of you and started to pull over, were the vehicles ahead of you actually stopped?  Did they appear to be braking? Did they appear to be moving?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: So there were -- the amount of vehicles I don't remember, but I do remember that there were vehicles sideways.  There were vehicles, you know, like, in driving position, I guess, that you could see going down the highway.  Some were stopped.  Some were sliding.  There were people coming up from my left that were sliding.  It was just --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It was kind of chaotic?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: That's a word for it, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have any difficulty braking?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: No, not that I remember.  I was able to stop my car, so --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, did you slide at all?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: It was a little slippery, so I possibly could have a little bit.  I don't see where I wouldn't have, but I wasn't, you know, going fast where when I applied the brakes, I was sliding all over the place.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But did it appear to you that there was some traction issues on the road?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Well, by view of the cars that were ahead of me that were sliding, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you at any point see any of the vehicles behind that white box truck that you have been shown in Exhibit 1?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: No.  There's no way I would have been able to see anything behind the white box truck.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So fair to say you wouldn't know how any of the vehicles behind the white box truck, how they were operating?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you wouldn't know their speed?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I would not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You wouldn't know if they were sliding all over the road?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I wouldn't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'll come over and use your photograph.
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Sure.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Kind of looking at a combination of Exhibit 2 and 3 --
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Are you on page 1 of 2?
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: I guess I'll use page 2 -- page 1 since it's numbered.
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: So looking at Exhibit 2, page 1, we've identified your car as number 5, right?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  I'll represent to you that the plaintiff, Heather Rhodes, has identified her vehicle as what's shown as number 3.
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And looking at Exhibit 3, do you see that same car that the plaintiff has identified as her vehicle in Exhibit 3?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Yes.  This one.  It has the same back.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So Exhibit 2, car number 3, is the same as the car we see in Exhibit 3?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you see the truck -- there are two cars shown in Exhibit 3, right?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And one is the plaintiff's car, and the other is the back rear of a truck?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you see this truck at all when you had stopped?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I don't remember seeing that truck at all.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know how that truck got into that position?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I don't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know if that truck had pulled over and stopped before any of these impacts that you described?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You had mentioned that you felt a couple of different impacts?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Yeah.  I would say five or six.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And from different sides of your car?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: One of the impacts that you felt was to the front of your car?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: There was an impact to the front of my car, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Other than the car that we see in Exhibit 6, which is the -- well, let me back up.  Exhibit 6, we see the white box truck, right?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: We see your vehicle?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And we also see the plaintiff's vehicle, or I'll represent to you it's the plaintiff's vehicle.
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Other than the plaintiff's vehicle in Exhibit 6, do you recall any other vehicle hitting the front of your car?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Yes.  On the passenger side of my car would have been -- on Exhibit 2, page 2 of 2, that Volkswagen Bug.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, that's the side of your car?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So we know at some point the VW wedged itself into the passenger side of your car?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But in terms of any vehicles that contacted the front of your car, looking at Exhibit 6, is the plaintiff's vehicle the only one you remember?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I don't.  And I don't remember.  I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Do you know how the damage to the front of your vehicle was created?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Somebody hit the front of my car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Could that have been the plaintiff's vehicle in Exhibit 6?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: It could have been.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know, were you hit more than once in the front of your vehicle?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: You know, I don't quite remember.  Like I said, I was hit a few different times at different spots.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you feel any impacts in the rear of your vehicle?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I did when I was hit by the box truck.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you feel any other impact after that?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: After that, I didn't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did the box truck behind your vehicle move at all after it collided with you the first time?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: No, not that I remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And after the box truck collided with the rear of your vehicle, did your car move at all?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: After the box truck had collided with my vehicle, no, not that I remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It didn't slide forward on the road?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: My car?  It could have been pushed from the box truck, but I don't -- it hit me, so -- and then I just remember being on the phone with work that morning and seeing the box truck come sliding at me, and I screamed.  I had to get off the phone.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You were in park, though, at the time the box truck hit you?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I was.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So it's fair, you do not have a recollection one way or the other if your vehicle moved at all from the impact with the box truck?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: At least you know that you didn't feel another impact in your rear other than the box truck?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: Not -- no, I don't think so.  Not to my recollection, no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever see the impact between the plaintiff's vehicle in Exhibit 3 and that black truck we see at the front end of Exhibit 3?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You mentioned there were additional cars that hit your driver's side, and then they continued to slide out of the area?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: They did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know if any of those cars that slid out of the area, if they impacted the plaintiff, Heather Rhode's, vehicle?
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I do not know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I have no further questions. Thank you.
speaker: MS. LOPEZ

text: I have one question.
speaker: MR. MCLAUGHLIN

text: Prior to putting your vehicle in park, was it involved in any collisions?
speaker: MR. MCLAUGHLIN

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That was the only question.
speaker: MR. MCLAUGHLIN

text: I have one or two redirect.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Earlier you were asked about traction issues on the road.  The question is did you have traction issues with your vehicle?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: As far as was I sliding?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Right.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't -- do you mean prior to when I put the brakes on and parked?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Sure.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't remember sliding.  I was able to stop my car.  My car was able to come to a stop, and I was able to put it in park.  I'm not sure if that answers your question.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall whether your car slid as you were braking?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: It possibly could.  I mean, I don't remember.  I mean, it was icy, so possibly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It's possible, but when you say you don't remember, you don't remember it sliding, or you don't remember one way or the other?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't remember it sliding.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you said your vehicle was hit in the front, do you know how that happened?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: There were multiple cars that hit me.  So I was parked.  So the cars must have driven into me.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the vehicle on Exhibit 6 that has the license plate 20 --
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- do you recall whether that car hit you?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall whether you hit that car?
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: If I drove into that car?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Or whether your vehicle was moved into that car.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Objection.
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: Whether by you or anyone else.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Objection.
speaker: MS. THEBAUD

text: I didn't drive into any cars that day.  My car was in park.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's all I have.  Thank you so much.
speaker: MR. LOVEALL

text: Just a quick question.
speaker: MR. MCLAUGHLIN

text: Was that Chrysler, did that arrive where it's located in Exhibit 6 after you put your vehicle in park?
speaker: MR. MCLAUGHLIN

text: After I put it in park?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.
speaker: MR. MCLAUGHLIN

text: No.  I had put my car in park, and there were no other cars around.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So the Chrysler would have only arrived --
speaker: MR. MCLAUGHLIN

text: After I put the car in park?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.
speaker: MR. MCLAUGHLIN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's it.
speaker: MR. MCLAUGHLIN
